title: Liyin He
text:
I will join Nicholas School of the Environment (NSOE) at Duke University as an assistant professor in Jan 2025! I am actively looking for dedicated and enthusiastic PhD students, Postdoctoral researchers, and visiting scholars to join our team. Please contact me he.liyin@duke.edu by including your CV, anticipated start date and research interests.
My research focuses on understanding the interrelationship between air, water, and ecosystem in the face of climate change, elevated CO2, air pollution, and different management practices. I use three main approaches: 1) spatiotemporal data analysis to interpret field and satellite observations; 2) machine learning approaches to generate novel datasets; and 3) process-based terrestrial biosphere models to understand the underlying mechanism. My work encompasses a wide range of scales—from the micro-level interactions within individual plants to macro-level regional and global patterns.

title: Opportunities
text:
I am actively looking for dedicated and enthusiastic PhD students, Postdoctoral researchers, and visiting scholars to join our team. There will be flexibility regarding scientific questions to be studied, but potential areas of focus include:

Advance understanding of the terrestrial carbon cycle by employing eddy covariance measurements, airborne/satellite remote sensing, atmospheric inversions, and Earth system modeling.
Investigate how various ecosystems, including agroecosystems, forests, urban ecosystems, drylands, and permafrost, respond to extreme events such as droughts, heatwaves, floods, wildfires, and hurricanes.
Evaluate the potential impact of nature-based solutions on carbon sequestration and agricultural sustainability.

Please contact me he.liyin@duke.edu by including your CV, anticipated start date and research interests.
